title: I handled insurance claims for decades. Here are the rules I had to follow — and why they matter to you
excerpt: Insurance is one of the most regulated industries. Adjusters can't just make up the rules as they go. Claims are governed by state laws and regulations, many of which are based on national guidelines like the Unfair Claims Settlement Practices Act (UCSPA).

title: What Aetna quitting the exchanges says about the exchanges
excerpt: Aetna is a minor player in the health insurance exchange market, and the exchanges are a small segment of the CVS Health subsidiary's business.

title: Apollo shakes off loss of 'Goldilocks' economy, keeps making money
excerpt: Apollo's total assets under management hit $785 billion at the end of Q1, a 17% year-over-year increase. Annuity sales were even better.

title: Beneva transitions core insurance operations to Guidewire cloud platform
excerpt: Beneva, a mutual insurance company in Canada, has transitioned its core insurance operations to the Guidewire cloud platform to streamline operations. The company has implemented Guidewire PolicyCenter and BillingCenter to enhance underwriting,

title: Meet the 20 PGA of America Golf Professionals Playing in the PGA Championship
excerpt: The 2025 PGA Professional Championship has crowned its champion, Tyler Collet, who will lead the Corebridge Financial Team at the 2025 PGA Championship held at Quail Hollow. This year's event has also qualified the top 20 scorers to compete in the prestigious PGA Championship, marking a significant milestone for these golf professionals.

title: Caisse posts positive results

title: Edward Jones To Offer Alt Investments To Private Clients
excerpt: Edward Jones Generations, the firm's first private client services offering for U.S. high-net-worth clients, launched in March. The move to expand its product line to include private investments is the latest in its efforts to appeal to wealthy investors, Tipper said.
